result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 9:19 a.m. 
**Includes 13CF973, 14CF31, 14CF66, 14CF264 & 14TR1167**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Robert Gardner. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. 
State files Amended Information in 13CF973, 14CF66 & 14CF264 . State moves to amend 13CF973- Ct.1 Substantial Battery to Misdemeanor Battery, amend 14CF66- 1st Degree Reckless Injury to 2nd Degree Reckless Injury with a Dangerous Weapon(Repeater)(Domestic Abuse), amend 14CF264 Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Felony) to Bail Jumping (Misd) & amend Ct.2- Bail Jumping (Felony) to Bail Jumping (Misd). State also moves to: 
13CF973- DRI Ct.1 
14CF31- DRI Ct.1-4
14CF66- DRI Ct.2-4
14CF264- DRI Ct.1 & Ct.2 
14TR1167- DISMISS
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF66- Ct.1-- 2nd Degree Reckless Injury with a Dangerous Weapon (Repeater)(Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 60 days. Sentencing Hearing to be scheduled with JA. 
Voter Ineligibility Notice and Acknowledgment signed and filed.
